   19: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   20: %%% File    : wx_basic_SUITE.erl
   21: %%% Author  : Dan Gudmundsson <dan.gudmundsson@ericsson.com>
   22: %%% Description : Basic SUITE, some simple tests to show that the basics 
   23: %%%               are working.
   24: %%% Created :  3 Nov 2008 by Dan Gudmundsson <dan.gudmundsson@ericsson.com>
   25: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   26: -module(wx_xtra_SUITE).
   27: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   28: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   29: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   30: 
   31: -export([destroy_app/1, destroy_app2/1, multiple_add_in_sizer/1, app_dies/1,
   32:          menu_item_debug/1]).
   33: 
   34: -include("wx_test_lib.hrl").
   35: 
   36: %% Initialization functions.
   37: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   38:     wx_test_lib:init_per_suite(Config).
   39: 
   40: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   41:     wx_test_lib:end_per_suite(Config).
   42: 
   43: init_per_testcase(Func,Config) ->
   44:     wx_test_lib:init_per_testcase(Func,Config).
   45: end_per_testcase(Func,Config) -> 
   46:     wx_test_lib:end_per_testcase(Func,Config).
   47: 
   48: %% SUITE specification
   49: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}, {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [destroy_app, destroy_app2, multiple_add_in_sizer, app_dies,
   53:      menu_item_debug].
   54: 
   55: groups() -> 
   56:     [].
   57: 
   58: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   59:     Config.
   60: 
   61: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: 
   65: %% The test cases
   66: 
   67: %%  Verify that everything is handled on the queue first
   68: %%  before wx:destroy is called.
   69: destroy_app(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
   70: destroy_app(_Config) ->
   71:     %% This is timing related but we test a couple of times
   72:     wx_test_lib:flush(),
   73:     ?m(ok, destroy_app_test(15)).
   74: 
   75: destroy_app_test(N) when N > 0 ->
   76:     Wx = ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()),    
   77:     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, 1, "Destroy"),
   78:     ?m(ok, wxFrame:destroy(Frame)),
   79:     receive 
   80: 	Msg -> Msg
   81:     after 150 -> 
   82: 	    wx:destroy(),
   83: 	    destroy_app_test(N-1)
   84:     end;
   85: destroy_app_test(_) -> 
   86:     receive 
   87: 	Msg -> Msg
   88:     after 1000 ->  ok
   89:     end.
   90: 
   91: destroy_app2(_Config) ->
   92:     Wx = wx:new(),
   93:     F = wxFrame:new(Wx, 1, "Destroy"),
   94:     Env = wx:get_env(),
   95:     spawn(fun() ->
   96:                   wx:set_env(Env),
   97:                   wx:destroy()
   98:           end),
   99:     timer:sleep(50),
  100:     wxFrame:destroy(F),
  101:     timer:sleep(500),
  102:     ok.
  103: 
  104: 
  105: %% This should work, and does but not when run automatically on windows 
  106: %% for some strange reason (it just hangs), run it last.
  107: app_dies(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  108: app_dies(_Config) ->
  109:     Tester = fun(Die0) ->
  110: 		     Die = (Die0*2) + ?LINE,
  111: 		     Wx = wx:new(),
  112: 		     oops(Die,?LINE),
  113: 		     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, 1, ?MODULE_STRING ++ integer_to_list(?LINE)),
  114: 		     oops(Die,?LINE),
  115: 		     wxFrame:createStatusBar(Frame, []),
  116: 		     oops(Die,?LINE),
  117: 		     Win=wxWindow:new(Frame, ?wxID_ANY),
  118: 		     oops(Die,?LINE),
  119: 		     _Pen  = wxPen:new({0,0,0}, [{width, 3}]),
  120: 		     oops(Die,?LINE),
  121: 		     _Font = wxFont:new(10, ?wxSWISS, ?wxNORMAL, ?wxNORMAL,[]),
  122: 		     oops(Die,?LINE), 
  123: 		     wxWindow:connect(Win, key_up),  
  124: 		     oops(Die,?LINE),
  125: 		     wxWindow:connect(Win, key_up, [{callback, fun(_,_) -> callback end}]),
  126: 		     oops(Die,?LINE),
  127: 		     wxFrame:show(Frame),
  128: 		     oops(Die,?LINE),
  129: 		     timer:sleep(100), %% Let the window be shown before DC can be created
  130: 		     DC0  = wxClientDC:new(Win),
  131: 		     oops(Die,?LINE),
  132: 		     DC   = wxBufferedDC:new(DC0),
  133: 		     oops(Die,?LINE),
  134: 		     _Size = wxWindow:getSize(Win),
  135: 		     oops(Die,?LINE),		    %% redraw(DC, Size, G),
  136: 		     wxBufferedDC:destroy(DC),
  137: 		     oops(Die,?LINE),
  138: 		     wxClientDC:destroy(DC0),
  139: 		     oops(last,?LINE)
  140: 	     end,
  141:     process_flag(trap_exit,true),
  142:     app_dies2(Tester, 1),
  143:     ok.
  144: 
  145: app_dies2(Test, N) ->
  146:     spawn_link(fun() -> Test(N) end),
  147:     receive
  148: 	{'EXIT', _, {oops, Server, What}} ->
  149: 	    Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Server),
  150: 	    receive {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, _} -> ok end,
  151: 	    timer:sleep(100),
  152: 	    What =/= last andalso app_dies2(Test, N+1)
  153:     end.
  154: 
  155: oops(Die, Line) when (Die =:= last) orelse (Die =< Line) ->
  156:     timer:sleep(200),
  157:     ?log(" Exits at line ~p~n",[Line]),
  158:     Server = element(3, wx:get_env()),
  159:     exit({oops, Server, Die});
  160: oops(_,_) -> ok.
  161: 
  162: 
  163: %% This have happened often enough that I have special code to handle 
  164: %% this user error (i.e. using the a window twice in an sizer).
  165: multiple_add_in_sizer(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  166: multiple_add_in_sizer(Config) ->
  167:     Wx = wx:new(),
  168:     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, -1, "Button Fix"),
  169:     wxFrame:connect(Frame, close_window),
  170: 
  171:     FramePanel = wxPanel:new(Frame),
  172:     Sizer = wxBoxSizer:new(?wxVERTICAL),
  173:     wxPanel:setSizer(FramePanel, Sizer),
  174:     wxSizer:setSizeHints(Sizer, Frame),
  175: 
  176:     Panel = wxPanel:new(FramePanel),
  177:     Button = wxButton:new(Panel, -1, [{label, "Centre Me!"}]),
  178: 
  179:     PanelSizer = wxBoxSizer:new(?wxVERTICAL),
  180: 
  181: %%%%%%%%%%% THIS CALL CRASHES BEAM AT DESTROY TIME %%%%%%%%%%%%%
  182:     wxPanel:setSizer(Panel, PanelSizer),
  183: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  184:     
  185:     ButtonSizer = wxBoxSizer:new(?wxVERTICAL),
  186: 
  187:     SizerFlags = wxSizerFlags:new(),
  188:     wxSizerFlags:align(SizerFlags, ?wxALIGN_CENTRE),
  189: 
  190:     wxSizer:add(ButtonSizer, Button, SizerFlags), %% no tricks
  191: 
  192:     wxSizerFlags:expand(SizerFlags), %
  193:     wxSizer:add(PanelSizer, ButtonSizer, SizerFlags),
  194: 
  195:     %% PanelSizer is added to a size twice
  196:     wxSizer:add(Sizer, PanelSizer, SizerFlags),
  197: 
  198:     wxFrame:setSize(Frame, 400, 300),
  199:     io:format("Panel ~p PSizer ~p ~n",[Panel, PanelSizer]),
  200:     %% io:format("F
  201:     wxWindow:show(Frame),
  202:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  203: 
  204: menu_item_debug(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  205: menu_item_debug(Config) ->
  206:     %% Debugging a menu entry problem
  207:     %% Run it with: lists:map(fun(_) -> [{0,{ok,_,_}}] = wxt:t() end, lists:seq(1,50)), ok.
  208:     Wx = wx:new(),
  209:     wx:debug(trace),
  210:     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, -1, "Button Fix"),
  211:     wxFrame:connect(Frame, close_window),
  212: 
  213:     wxPanel:new(Frame),
  214:     MenuBar = create_menus(Frame),
  215:     wxWindow:show(Frame),
  216:     N = wxMenuBar:getMenuCount(MenuBar),
  217:     io:format("No of menus ~p~n",[N]),
  218:     [io:format("Menu ~p ~p~n",[Id, wxMenuBar:getMenuLabelText(MenuBar, Id)])
  219:      || Id <- lists:seq(0, N-1)],
  220:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame,Config).
  221: 
  222: 
  223: create_menus(Frame) ->
  224:     MenuBar = ?mt(wxMenuBar, wxMenuBar:new()),
  225:     File    = ?mt(wxMenu, wxMenu:new([])),
  226:     Help    = ?mt(wxMenu, wxMenu:new([])),
  227: 
  228:     ?mt(wxMenuItem, wxMenu:append(Help, ?wxID_ABOUT, "&About", [])),
  229:     ?mt(wxMenuItem, wxMenu:append(Help, ?wxID_HELP, "&Help", [])),
  230:     ?mt(wxMenuItem, wxMenu:append(File, ?wxID_EXIT, "Exit", [])),
  231:     T1    = ?mt(wxMenu, wxMenu:new([])),
  232:     [wxMenuItem:getId(wxMenu:append(T1, Id, integer_to_list(Id), []))
  233:      || Id <- lists:seq(100, 120)],
  234:     T2    = ?mt(wxMenu, wxMenu:new([])),
  235:     [wxMenuItem:getId(wxMenu:append(T2, Id, integer_to_list(Id), []))
  236:      || Id <- lists:seq(200, 220)],
  237:     T3    = ?mt(wxMenu, wxMenu:new([])),
  238:     [wxMenuItem:getId(wxMenu:append(T3, Id, integer_to_list(Id), []))
  239:      || Id <- lists:seq(300, 320)],
  240:     T4    = ?mt(wxMenu, wxMenu:new([])),
  241:     [wxMenuItem:getId(wxMenu:append(T4, Id, integer_to_list(Id), []))
  242:      || Id <- lists:seq(400, 420)],
  243:     T5    = ?mt(wxMenu, wxMenu:new([])),
  244:     [wxMenuItem:getId(wxMenu:append(T5, Id, integer_to_list(Id), []))
  245:      || Id <- lists:seq(500, 520)],
  246:     T6    = ?mt(wxMenu, wxMenu:new([])),
  247:     [wxMenuItem:getId(wxMenu:append(T6, Id, integer_to_list(Id), []))
  248:      || Id <- lists:seq(600, 620)],
  249: 
  250:     ?m(ok,wxFrame:connect(Frame, command_menu_selected)),
  251: 
  252:     ?m(true, wxMenuBar:insert(MenuBar, 0,File, "&File")),
  253:     ?m(true, wxMenuBar:insert(MenuBar, 1,Help, "&Help")),
  254:     ?m(true, wxMenuBar:insert(MenuBar, 2,T1, "T1")),
  255:     ?m(true, wxMenuBar:insert(MenuBar, 3,T2, "T2")),
  256:     ?m(true, wxMenuBar:insert(MenuBar, 4,T3, "T3")),
  257:     ?m(true, wxMenuBar:insert(MenuBar, 5,T4, "T4")),
  258:     ?m(true, wxMenuBar:insert(MenuBar, 6,T5, "T5")),
  259:     ?m(true, wxMenuBar:insert(MenuBar, 7,T6, "T6")),
  260: 
  261:     ?m(ok, wxFrame:setMenuBar(Frame,MenuBar)),
  262:     MenuBar.
